title: Client Consulting Associate Summer Undergraduate Intern
requirements:
Client Consulting Associate (Summer 2021 Undergraduate Intern)

Visa

Posted Under: Providence, Rhode Island jobs in Professions; Professions jobs in zipcode 02940

Posted On: 2021-02-28
• *COMPANY DESCRIPTION**

As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
YOU'RE an Individual. WE'RE the team for you. TOGETHER, let's transform the way the world pays.
• *JOB DESCRIPTION**

PLEASE NOTE: This summer internship role will be fully virtual. Application deadline is 3/5/2021, interviews mid March, offers out by end of March.

The Visa Consulting and Analytics team is looking for interns to support the team on strategic consulting engagements.The ideal candidate is a highly analytical individual ideally with previous business experience.
Typical projects may include:

- How does a financial institution increase market share in consumer credit cards?
- How should a credit card issuer use emerging technology to acquire the best customers?
- How does a financial institution grow their credit card portfolio while mitigating credit risk?
- How does a financial institution optimize their product offering?
• *RESPONSIBILITIES:**

- Play an integral role on a team of experienced professionals in delivering strategic consulting services to key Visa clients
- Complete consulting engagements with other team members, including participating in interviews, analyzing confidential client data, and summarizing key findings
- Conduct industry research and identify internal and external data resources to create custom analytics
- Complete detailed analysis on client data and identify preliminary trends and themes in the data
- Develop client-specific presentations which address executive needs and deliver presentations to clients and internal Visa partners
• *WORK AUTHORIZATION:**

- Authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment for this position. Visa will not sponsor applicants for work visas in connection with this position.
• *LOCATION:**

- Remote - Virtual internship
- By applying to this position,you are open to working in one of the following locations if you receive a full time return offer: Foster City, CA; San Francisco, CA; Ashburn, VA; New York City; Atlanta, GA.
• *WORK HOURS:**

- Incumbent must make themselves available during core business hours.
• *TRAVEL**

- No travel required
• *PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

- This position will be performed in an at-home office setting.The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, reach with hands and arms.
• *EEOC**

- Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law

title: Lex Frieden Change Management Consulting Intern - Summer 2021
requirements:
Description
SHIFT: Day Job SCHEDULE: Full-time _Your Talent. Our Vision._ AT ANTHEM, INC., it's a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we're creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities.

Join us and together we will DRIVE THE FUTURE OF HEALTH CARE. This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health care companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company. Anthem seeks innovative, high energy problem solvers to work with and learn from cross-functional teams as we transform the way we generate value for our customers by: - Creating proactive and personalized experiences for customers - Driving cross-functional connectivity in what, why, and how we deliver to our stakeholders - Rethinking how, where and by whom work gets done to make a difference in the communities we serve - Building accountability for delivery of people process, and technology improvements and subsequent value realization - Advancing key behaviors and mindset changes to scale customer-centricity across the enterprise - Accelerating organizational change as a change management champion Our internship program is designed to strengthen your understanding of the healthcare industry and prepare you for future opportunities through: - Meaningful work contributions aligned to our efforts to improve stakeholder experiences - Leadership exposure and networking opportunities - Targeted training and enrichment experiences that develop your business acumen and provide deep insight into the many facets of healthcare - Connections to enterprise and business unit intern cohorts - Focused and intentional mentoring and support from a team that is fully invested in your success - Access to our extensive training and development resources, tools and classes Examples of past intern projects include: - Artificial intelligence pilot to predict patient care needs - ID card pilot for address management system - Change management training module creation and rollout - Salesforce intake and workflow creation - Clinical decisioning framework development

title: 2022 - Summer - Consulting Intern - Strategy & Management - Project Management
requirements:
As a management consulting intern at RSM, you will workwith businesses in diverse industries and receive hands-on client experiencewith direct access to executive management. Assigned to numerous projects, youwill work on several components of any particular assignment—not just one smallpart—and you will feel a great sense of accomplishment with what youaccomplish. Working in a mutually respectful team environment helps ourconsultants perform at their best and advance their career and professionalcapabilities.

RSM’s management consulting practice helps businessesaccelerate their future. Our management consultants are passionate aboutinnovating to drive business growth. Our collaborative approach incorporatesindustry and functional expertise with a focus on intelligent automation tooptimize and enhance the efficiency of business operations. Our core offeringsinclude business transformation and improvement services for finance andaccounting, technology, human capital, supply chain and operations leaders,along with strategy execution services to drive projects from start to finish.

Consultants provide high value professional services toRSM's clients by performing the duties and responsibilities listed below:

- Meet with clients and conduct management consulting projects based on client needs
- Facilitate workshops to gather and document business needs, requirements, opportunities and challenges
- Assist business representatives, project managers and functional leadership in optimizing the scope, benefits and risks of proposed projects
- Conduct benchmarking research and analysis for business spend, innovation trends and industry practices
- Provide leadership when working with solution vendors
- Prepare reports on RSM services performed for clients, delivering reports where appropriate and discussing results and recommendations with clients
- Work with clients to provide analysis, development and documentation of improvement opportunities; this may include implementation and training components
- Complete client projects effectively and efficiently and maintaining a high level of proficiency and integrity
- Travel to client locations as required

RSM’S MANAGEMENTCONSULTING PRACTICE INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING SPECIALTY AREAS:

- Finance & Accounting
- Human Capital
- Mergers & Acquisitions
- Operations & Supply Chain
- Project Management
- Strategy & Execution
- Technology & Digital

title: Consulting - Internship
requirements:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders-empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

What You'll Do We accept online applications from exceptional business school, engineering, science, law, and humanities students who are nearing completion of their undergraduate or graduate studies. Like our full-time staff, you'll work alongside some of the world's top minds on cases that reshape business, government, and society. Consulting work is varied and rigorous, much of it performed at our client sites. Projects can vary in length, size, and location, depending on the client's challenge. You'll collaborate on challenging projects with team members from many backgrounds and disciplines, increasing your understanding of complex business problems from diverse perspectives and developing new skills and experience to help you in the future, be that at BCG or beyond.

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
BCG is an E-Verify Employer. for more information on E-Verify.

The Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws

title: Consulting Intern
requirements:
We are Domosapiens- uniquely skilled, passionate data lovers anchored in a culture of connectivity. We are transforming the way business is managed by putting real-time data into the hands of every decision maker across organizations. Diversity is valued here because homogenized teams create echo chambers; and nobody benefits from that. The insight garnered from diverse backgrounds, perspectives and lived experiences results in pioneering innovations across the organization and better experiences for our customers. The more diverse our talent, the more impactful the Domosphere becomes.

Position Summary

Working as a member of Domo's Client Services team, the Consulting Intern will work on customer-facing projects – focused on discovering customer needs, designing solutions, data connection, ETL, and dashboard building.

Key Responsibilities
Manage relationships with Domo customers. Help them implement the Domo platform. Work closely with Domo Customers to understand their technical and business needs and devise solutions to solve for those needs.
Connect and transform (using Domo's ETL tools) customer datasets that will be used to provide data insights critical to customers' business.
Own communications with the customer throughout the implementation process.
Become highly capable using the Domo platform.


Job Requirements
In pursuit of a Bachelor's Degree in a technical field (Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, or another related field, etc.).
Strong knowledge and skill at writing SQL queries and extensive exposure to SQL-centric work.
Evidence of participation in at least one data analytics project, which may include visualizations, presentations, reports, etc.
Very strong communication skills and experience working directly with customers.
Ability to demonstrate creative problem solving and independently generate solutions using analytical skills and technical knowledge.
Basic understanding of project management.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and embraces change, creativity, and flexibility.
Capable of learning and adapting quickly to varied requirements.

Domo is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Corporate Strategy Intern
requirements:
Corporate Strategy Intern

Corporate Development and Strategy Team | Chegg
Remote, United States

Your goal - to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- by interning in Chegg’s Corporate Development and Strategy group.

Organization: Corporate Development and Strategy

The Corporate Development and Strategy team is an integral part of Chegg - We work closely with the C-team to develop and execute the company’s overall strategy. Execution of strategy includes making decisions around whether the company should buy, build or partner, and therefore is closely tied to the Corporate Development function. Our small team is comprised of analysts, strategists, thought leaders, relationship builders, and dealmakers. The team drives to an understanding of relevant markets, builds out the landscape, sources deals, negotiates and closes transactions, and then develops and manages the integration plan. We also conduct market and competitive research into education trends and areas of future opportunity.

Role: Corporate Development and Strategy Intern

We’re looking for a highly motivated intern to help our team work on strategic projects in concert with the company’s business and product leaders. You will conduct research in support of our strategic roadmap and work across a number of business units, including Learning Services, Skills, and Life. The right candidate will be a self-starter with strong organizational skills and have the ability to think critically about industry and company trends.

Responsibilities
Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape
Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities
Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities
Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases
Present key findings and recommendations to executives

Requirements
A rising sophomore or junior currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder).
Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer
Have the ability to work 40 hours per week
Strong analytical and communication skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments

Nice To Have
Experience with market research and business analysis
Demonstrated passion for education and technology
Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting
Project or internship experience in the education industry
What project will the intern work on?

The strategy intern will support a variety of initiatives, including contributing to the strategic planning of Chegg’s expansion into new international markets for our Learning Services and Skills business units and new non-academic verticals related to our Life business unit. Through primary and secondary research, the intern will develop an understanding of our focus markets, map the competitive landscape in each of these markets, and meaningfully shape Chegg’s entry strategy in these markets. Through their support of these initiatives, the intern will work closely with the Strategy & Corporate development team, as well as cross-functionally with a variety of Chegg’s business units.

What skills will the intern gain?
Advanced Excel
Market research
Business analysis
Basic accounting

See what it’s like to be a Chegg intern!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp1m_ZtOT_4

Learn more about Chegg!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo

About Chegg

Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California, and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

United States Remote: This is a remote position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.

title: Consulting Intern: Summer 2021
requirements:
About You

I have a proven track record of academic success

I am thoroughly organized with exemplary attention to detail, and have strong analytical and communication skills

I am comfortable interacting with clients and know when to ask questions and when to listen

I am comfortable working with data and large amounts of information

I love to learn new things

I am a quick learner, and excel when working in a fast-paced environment

I am always asking questions to get a comprehensive view of the issue at hand

I bring an innovative spirit and a superior work ethic to every professional engagement

Job Description

As an OnPrem Intern, you will engage in different types of business consulting and technology projects ranging from organization and process reviews, to the formulation and analysis of business, process, and organizational strategies, to the implementation of technology solutions. You will work on a project team of other consultants and/or a Project Manager at a client site. Although projects vary, you can expect to dive deep into the client business. You will contribute by assisting with deliverables, taking notes, documenting requirements, testing technologies and participating in stakeholder interviews and workshops.

About Us

We’re in the business of making businesses better—people, processes, and systems. We’re an end-to-end technology solutions provider focused on connecting disparate parts within organizations. We bring a balance of IQ and EQ to every engagement, and a depth of business and technical acumen to every problem. We are a team that is driven by following through for our clients, and being upfront, honest and sincere.

Requirements
One year left in an undergraduate or graduate degree
Experience with presentation and spreadsheet tools, such as PowerPoint, Visio, and Excel
Experience and/or strong interest in the Media and Entertainment industry, specifically Studios or Broadcasters
Exceptional analytical skills
History of success throughout academic career
Strong communication skills, written and oral
Experience excelling in a team environment
Ability to work on projects with demanding deadlines
Strong organizational and “follow-through” skills
Above average work ethic
An innovative spirit
Attention to detail
Life at OnPrem

We were founded on a culture of collaboration and inclusiveness, and this permeates each of our initiatives, both client-facing and internal. We offer a wide selection of benefits including medical, dental & vision, 401k matching and flexible vacation; we sponsor trainings to advance our teams’ skill sets; we prioritize our employees’ professional growth paths. Currently 200+ people strong in four geographic territories, we’ve been recognized as a “Best Place to Work,” a “Great Place to Work,” “Fastest Growing,” and “A Jewel.”

Visa Status

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Equal Employment Opportunity

OnPrem Solution Partners ensures equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

requirements:
Gallagher is a global leader in insurance, risk management and consulting services. We help businesses grow, communities thrive and people prosper. We live a culture defined by The Gallagher Way, our set of shared values and guiding tenets. A culture driven by our people, over 30,000 strong, serving our clients with customized solutions that will protect them and fuel their futures.

Position Summary

Gallagher offers students an opportunity to participate in a paid Summer Internship program focused in one or more Corporate functions and disciplines. The program is designed to help them gain practical knowledge in a corporate environment and assess future career interests. During the internship, the intern will assist with various projects that support business needs.

Required

title: Consulting Intern
requirements:
Company Description

Aciron Consulting, Inc. is a business management and technology consulting firm based in Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA. Combining in-depth technical and industry experience with a commitment to building collaborative relationships with clients, we deliver innovative services and solutions that meet clients' most complex business and technical needs.

At Aciron, we apply the same values and beliefs to our staff as we do to our clients and we truly believe in fostering open communication, collaboration, and innovation in the workplace. Our people-centric approach and entrepreneurial work environment allow you to discover and cultivate your passions, learn from and work closely with talented colleagues, and shape your own professional development and career.

Job Description

We are currently seeking a Consulting Intern. The intern will support the Aciron team in helping clients achieve more efficient processes and in developing innovative, user-friendly technology solutions. The intern will be exposed to real world challenges and rewarding experiences, including participating in the documentation, design, and research processes and in ensuring optimal user experiences and client satisfaction. The ideal candidate must have a strong a desire to gain exposure to the consulting field, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and be motivated to learn.

What will I be doing?
Providing design and strategy support for the development of custom web application solutions
Assisting in delivering optimal user experiences
Researching and implementing best design and user experience ideas and strategies
Assisting with capturing and documenting client needs
Creating requirements specification documents and PowerPoint presentations
Supporting client projects and internal initiatives by producing high-quality deliverables and participating in meetings and brainstorming sessions
Conducting thorough industry and client research and analysis
Assisting with ensuring that company application solutions comply with defined requirements
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to assist with business development, product development, and marketing efforts

Qualifications
Current undergraduate student or recent graduate
Strong desire to learn about business and consulting
Interest in working in a small business environment
Excellent written and verbal skills
Understanding of human behavior and interactions with web applications
Highly creative with interest in user experience design
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively
Ability to plan and organize projects, prioritize, and multitask
Team player with positive and proactive attitude
Dependable and responsible

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Please apply with a resume and a cover letter. In addition, please note that we will be reviewing applications as they arrive, so please apply at your convenience.

title: Consulting Intern
requirements:
At Woodard & Curran, there’s nothing we love more than a tough engineering challenge. We handle a wide range of water and environmental issues—solving complex problems with creativity and tenacity. That’s how we make a difference to our clients, people, and planet. Our company was founded on a simple concept: provide a safe and enjoyable place to work with opportunity, integrity, and commitment, and we will attract talented people. Those people are at the heart of our firm, solving some of the most pressing water and environmental challenges for our clients.

Responsibilities

We are looking for a motivated Software Engineering Intern to join our company. If you want to jumpstart your career and expand your skills while working alongside talented experts, then this is the opportunity for you! You will be involved with project work from your first day, working side-by-side with experienced engineers, planners, and scientists to help clients address their water and environmental challenges. Exercise your creativity and problem solving skills in a supportive environment where every perspective is valued. We are a mission-driven organization that puts our people first, with a culture that focuses on providing meaningful work, engaging challenges, recognition, and reward.

Duties and responsibilities vary based on level of experience and project expectations. An intern will generally shadow experienced professionals and participate as a member of a team by contributing to actual projects. Interns are able to apply what they have learned “from the classroom” via experience based-learning.

This Internship Position will be based in our Sacramento, CA Office.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate will be a second or third year Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar with interest in environmental, sustainability, or water resources data management t.

You will need to attach a professional cover letter, as well as your resume. Your resume should include your GPA as well as a sample of courses that you’ve taken at college.

Woodard & Curran is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.

Woodard & Curran is a Drug Free Work Place.

Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.

title: Corporate Intern - Strategy/Internal Consulting
requirements:
Welcome to Ross Stores, Inc., where our differences make us stronger… At Ross and dd’s, inclusion is a way of life. We care about our Associates and the communities we serve and we value their differences. We are committed to building diverse teams and an inclusive culture. We respect and celebrate the diversity of backgrounds, identities, and ideas of those who work and shop with us. Come join us as we continue our diversity, equality and inclusion journey!

General Purpose

As a Corporate Intern at Ross you will have the opportunity to experience the world of off-price retail and be a part of a growing Fortune 500 company. This position is based in Dublin, California at our corporate headquarters. This internship prepares students for a potential career in retail, allowing you a real-world perspective on a career at Ross. Interns will gain insight into the objectives of their department and the daily responsibilities of an analyst at Ross.

Skills

The ideal Intern candidate for the Strategy Department will have an interest in management consulting and business strategy and will possess the following skills

Intellectual curiosity (candidate proactively pursues learning opportunities)
A clear understanding of basic business, financial, statistical, and economic concepts
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong written and oral communication skills
Able to work effectively both individually and as a member of a team

The Strategy Intern will gain exposure to multiple areas of the business, interaction with Senior Leadership, project management experience and the opportunity to learn new software.

Strategy Serves Two Main Functions

"Internal consulting": Strategy supports other departments on projects where they do not have either the capacity or the analytical capabilities to do the work themselves. Strategy's role includes managing cross-functional teams, breaking down complex problems, and communicating with executives.
Business strategy: Strategy is responsible for analyzing the external environment (competitors, consumer preferences, and the economy) in an effort to develop long-term strategic growth options and competitive responses to industry forces.

Examples Of Possible Projects Include

Business performance drivers - Analyze various performance metrics (often at the store level) including sales, transactions, and inventory
Consumer research - Conduct and analyze quantitative and qualitative consumer research in order to better understand our customers' attitudes and behavior (e.g. which product categories are most important to shoppers, how do customers view Ross vs. our competitors)
Cross-functional initiatives - Collaborate with other departments to conduct analyses for key executive-level priorities (e.g. new store format improvement, roll-out strategy for new business opportunities)

Intern Program Outline

The Ross Intern program is a 10-week full-time program (40 hours per week) for college level Juniors, starting in early June ending mid-August. The Intern Program will cover training on project related responsibilities, ownership of a department related project as well as exposure to senior leadership and other departments within Ross corporate.

The main component of the internship will be to analyze a business project within your department while participating in daily department activities. Interns will be expected to present a final project analysis and presentation.

Competencies
Problem Solving
Communication
Learning on the Fly
Time Management
Integrity
Excel / PPT Skills

Qualifications And Special Skills Required
Must currently be enrolled in 4-year college degree program; must currently be in Junior standing with expected graduation between December 2021 and August 2022
MS Office with strong practical application of Excel skills
Ability to demonstrate use of PowerPoint skills
Strong analytical skills with spreadsheet applications
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Able to work in a fast paced environment
Organized and detail-oriented
Retail experience a plus

Physical Requirements/Ada

Job requires ability to work in an office environment, primarily on a computer.
Requires sitting, standing, walking, hearing, talking on the telephone, attending in-person meetings, typing, and working with paper/files, etc.
Consistent timeliness and regular attendance.
Vision requirements: Ability to see information in print and/or electronically.

DISCLAIMER
This position description is a summary of the primary duties and responsibilities of the job and position. It is not intended to be a comprehensive or all-inclusive listing of duties and responsibilities. Contents are subject to change at management's discretion.

requirements:
The Consulting Services Intern will support RAINN's Consulting Services and Business Development (CSBD) department in its work with organizations seeking to improve their prevention and response to sexual misconduct. The Consulting Services Intern will assist in the review of research, development of best practices, and evaluation of specific client programs.

College or Graduate students with an emphasis in their studies on Public Health, Social Work, Gender Studies, Political Science, Business, or Public and/or Non-profit Administration are encouraged to apply. However, all areas of studies are welcome.

This position will start in June 2021, with work completed remotely.

Conducting research in prevention and response efforts (i.e., statutes and regulatory law, medical and mental health support for victims, and programmatic strategies)
Supporting business development by researching potential clients, sectors, and industries
Providing editing and content review
Developing visual presentations for internal and external meetings
Drafting proposals and outreach materials

Desired Qualities:
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Strong research skills (experience with comprehensive literature reviews a plus)
Robust qualitative analytical skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office programs (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Exceptional writing and editing skills
Aptitude to deliver in accordance with project timelines
Capability to successfully complete a criminal background check administered by RAINN
Desired Education:
At least one completed year at an institution of higher education

This is a remote, unpaid, part-time position and requires a minimum of 12 hours per week. CSBD employees will work with the student and the university to ensure college credit is given for the internship, if applicable.

title: Boston College 2021 Campus Summer Intern
requirements:
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

About Ankura: Ankura is an expert services firm defined by HOW we solve challenges. Whether a client is facing an immediate business challenge, trying to increase the value of their company or protect against future risks, Ankura designs, develops, and executes tailored solutions by assembling the right combination of expertise. We build on this experience with every case, client, and situation, collaborating to create innovative, customized solutions, and strategies designed for today’s ever-changing business environment. This gives our clients unparalleled insight and experience across a wide range of economic, governance, and regulatory challenges. At Ankura, we know that collaboration drives results.

Position: Ankura Summer Intern

Description: The Summer Internship Program has been created to give students an opportunity to learn what life as a consultant is like at Ankura. As an Intern, you will work on a variety of projects with different engagement teams. The program aims to give you exposure to the breadth of our services and client work. You will work closely with our professionals – Consultants through Director – and gain first-hand experience in consulting.

Business Groups
Construction, Disputes & Advisory: As a Construction Intern, you will develop analytical skills while being immersed in the world of client services. Construction Interns work directly with project team leaders and experts, assisting our experts in performing the detailed analyses required to provide the best solutions for our clients. Interns perform project schedule, cost, productivity, and statistical analyses as well as assist with review of key project issues through document review and database creation/management.
Data & Technology: Interns will be engaged on a variety of projects, internal initiatives, training opportunities and technical challenges, office-wide intern projects, and various social events. The internship program is focused on providing interns with the opportunity to learn about Ankura and the industry, learn and utilize new skills, and develop relationships. Interns will have the opportunity to learn, use, or gain exposure to a wide variety of programs, platforms, and programming languages, including SQL, Python, C#, VBA, and Tableau.
Disputes & Economics: Intern assignments will involve work in fact-finding, allocating costs, analyzing damages, organizing information, or helping to manage data. You will also learn new skills and participate in social and volunteer activities throughout the summer.
Risk, Forensics & Compliance: An ideal intern candidate should have an interest in forensic accounting, investigations, litigation consulting, as well as other related areas described above. Responsibilities will include applying technical accounting, forensic accounting, and analytical skills to various client situations. As an intern, Ankura will provide the opportunity to experience a variety of projects working collaboratively on small, diverse teams with skilled, intelligent, driven, and successful individuals.
Turnaround & Restructuring: T&R is an exciting, fast-paced environment in which our professionals’ partner with clients to address critical issues including over-levered balance sheets, liquidity constraints, unprofitable business units, and adverse industry conditions. Clients rely on Ankura professionals to solve complex challenges with the expectation that they will quickly assess the situation, develop a strategic plan, and effectively execute the turnaround. Our Summer Interns will be an integral part of our project teams.
Qualifications: Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, MIS, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or another analytical area of study; analytical problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset; ability to utilize technology to solve complex problems

Ankura is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where mutual respect and collaboration is paramount. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or any other legally protected status.

title: TCG Summer Internship Program - 2021
requirements:
TCG Summer Internship Program 2021

TCG Capital Management ("TCG") is an investment firm based in Los Angeles/San Francisco and invests in consumer internet, media, commerce, sports, and wellness companies. Investments include Food52, Everlywell, Headspace, MeatEater, Barstool Sports, The Action Network, The Athletic, Hodinkee, Surfline, Scopely, Sketchy Medical, ShopShops as well as many others.

TCG is offering a portfolio-wide internship program for the summer of 2021. TCG and many of our portfolio companies are looking for talented undergraduate juniors, as well as MBA candidates between their first and second years. TCG is an equal opportunity employer and champions inclusivity, diversity, education and access, and are looking to add team members who are champions of these core values.

The program will place interns both at TCG and at individual portfolio companies for a total of 10 weeks between June 7 and August 13. Given the challenges of the current COVID pandemic, this year's internships will likely take place remotely. Listed below are all of the individual positions TCG and participating portfolio companies will be filling. When applying for the program, please indicate which of the positions for which you would like to be considered. You should only apply once but can indicate interest in multiple roles.



TCG - Summer Investment Associate

A summer investment associate will become an integral part of TCG's investment team for the summer and will focus primarily on sourcing, evaluating, and executing growth equity and/or buyout investment opportunities. The summer associate will also be exposed to other TCG initiatives and broader company strategy. Finally, he/she will have frequent interaction with senior executives as well as entrepreneurs in the sectors of TCG focus.

What We're Looking For
Demonstrate a strong interest in consumer-facing sectors
Preferably candidates with finance, consulting, or corporate development experience
Flexible disposition, entrepreneurial spirit, analytical aptitude, and self-starter mentality are essential

Open For: MBA between 1st and 2nd years.

Engineering interns will spend the summer working with one of our portfolio companies. In addition to this work, engineering interns will be apart of a broader TCG internship curriculum that includes speaker series, mentorships with direct managers and TCG investors, resume builder, leadership presentations, and more.

Experience developing and launching a meaningful product/project from scratch
Self-starters
Position(s) of influence in campus organization or other

High attention to detail and accuracy and strong analytical skills
Excellent verbal and written communications skills

Proficient in Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel
Self-starters

Excellent verbal and written communications skills

requirements:

Graduates, interns and co-ops are key to the overall success of AECOM. We invest in initial career experience of graduates, interns and co-ops through the summer internship program and various other development opportunities. This serves as the foundation to building our pipeline of future leaders

requirements:
Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.

At Siemens Healthineers, we are passionate about enabling healthcare professionals to deliver high quality patient care, and to do so affordably. title: Business Development Intern
requirements:
Markacy Overview: Markacy is a digital strategy firm based out of New York City that partners with digitally powered consumer brands to help them achieve financial results. Our cross-functional team supports clients across media, CRM, web/mobile development, design, creative, branding, analytics, marketplace expansion, and financial planning. Our ability to combine strategy consulting, finance, and digital marketing sets us apart from traditional marketing agencies, as does our track record of financial results. We are disrupting the traditional digital marketing model by providing an elevated service focused on tangible impacts.

Role Mission: We are looking for a business development intern to join our rapidly growing team! A minimum availability of 2-3 days per week is required.

Core Responsibilities:
working with senior leadership and the business development to help execute strategic growth priorities across virtual events, networking, outbound/inbound sales support, and thought leadership
support new business opportunities including proposals and pitch deck creation
support content creation efforts including our weekly video series and market research reports
collaborate with team members across CRM, media, creative, and growth to support new business development and content creation opportunities

Minimum Requirements:
going into senior year of college/university, or recent graduate
pursuing or earned bachelor's degree in business administration, economics, marketing, or a similar field
strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
strong interpersonal and communication skills
strong attention to detail, project management and timeline management
solid presentation skills with an ability to tailor communications to a range of audiences
experience in sales and/or comfort with significant ambiguity
entrepreneurial and achievement/career-focused mindset

Individual Competencies:
Efficiency. Able to produce significant output with menial wasted effort. 
Drive. Strives for personal and professional development.
Honesty/Integrity. Does not cut corners ethically. Earns trust and maintains the confidence of those around him/her. Does what is right, not just what is politically expedient.
Organization and planning. Plans, organizes, schedules, and budgets in an efficient and productive manner. Focuses on key priorities and client success.
Aggressiveness. Moves quickly and takes a forceful stand without being overly abrasive to accomplish client and Markacy objectives. 
Follow-through on commitments. Lives up to verbal and written agreements, regardless of personal cost. 
Intelligence. Learn quickly. Demonstrates ability to quickly and proficiently understand and absorb new information. 
Analytical skills. Able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw insightful conclusions from it. Exhibits a probing mind and achieves penetrating insights. 
Attention to detail. Does not let important details slip through the cracks or derail a project.
Persistence. Demonstrates tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done.
Proactivity. Acts without being told what to do. Brings new ideas to the company.

Cultural Competencies:
Clients first. Building long-term sustainable relationships with our clients and delivering tangible growth results over multiple years is our daily north star.
Teamwork. Consulting is a team sport. We work together to make our clients better, support our team-members and drive innovative change. 
Data-driven. We don’t have hunches. We let the data do the talking and set specific KPIs with clients so we know what good looks like and where opportunities lie.
Cross-Channel. Growth is a full-time support and it takes an integrated cross-channel strategy. Our different teams work closely together to bring more integrated solutions to the table for our clients.
Innovation. We started Markacy to disrupt the marketing industry and create an agency solution that high-growth companies could actually scale with.
Entrepreneurial. We have big aspirations but will always embrace start-up tendencies and bring a scrappy, solution-oriented mindset to our work.
Hard-Working. We don’t shy away from hard work; we embrace it as we believe it is a key requisite for individual and team success.

title: Risk Advisory Intern - Fall 2021
requirements:
Who is Grant Thornton?

Hi. We’re Grant Thornton LLP, the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd (A.K.A. one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms.) With us, business feels more personal — for our clients and for you. That makes us different. Better. And we’re looking for applicants who are too.

Different how? It means working with numbers doesn’t make you a number. Here, your voice matters. Our inclusive community and caring culture rejects limits and egos, which helps make our work stronger and you thrive. From our global clients and no-silos style, we empower you with opportunity from day one, then set you up for long-term success with flexibility, resources and connections. It’s how we help you create a career you love — and more.

Com/careers And Read On To Learn More How You’ll Help Us Become Even Bolder

Interested. Get to know us better at gt.

What is Risk?

The digitization of currencies, transactions, relationships, experiences and assets has transformed entire industries. Technologies extend borders and reach, creating new customers, business partners, avenues of access, methods of innovation and forms of value. At the same time, ongoing disruption in the marketplace and in the competitive and regulatory landscape presents continually evolving strategic, operational, financial and other risks.

To move forward in this challenging environment, many management teams are turning to advisers like Grant Thornton LLP for broader industry and business perspectives and proven experience to assist them with developing and implementing their risk management programs, and providing attestations and certifications to validate the risk mitigation strategies relevant to their customers.

Grant Thornton’s Advisory professionals are progressive thinkers who create, protect, transform value today, so our clients have the opportunity to thrive and grow. Our advisory practice creates holistic solutions delivered by innovative, curious professionals who bring technical depth and industry insight to our clients.

Position Summary

Risk Interns are responsible for delivering engagements ranging from business process and information systems controls assessments and testing to support regulatory, compliance and other strategic and operational and attestation engagements.

Risk Advisory Services Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Evaluate and test business processes and IT controls and identify areas of risk
Apply current knowledge of trends to identify business risk management issues and other opportunities for improvement
Work with the client to plan engagement strategy, define objectives, and address business risks and issues and supporting controls
Work with risk teams and the client to plan engagement strategy, define objectives, and address business process and IT controls risks and issues
Execute assigned client engagements from start to completion of information systems assessments and/or business process control reviews
Gain a comprehensive understanding of assigned client operations, processes and business objectives, and then utilize that knowledge on assigned engagements
Participate in recruiting efforts as needed
Meet or exceed targeted billing hours (utilization)
Assist practice leadership in creating proposals, budgets, and work plans. Participate in other business development activities as appropriate
Other duties as assigned

Why become a Risk Intern?

Additional Responsibilities May Include

A Risk Intern will gain exposure to various areas of the practice by participating as an active member on consulting and compliance projects and by becoming an integral part of the delivery teams. As a Risk Intern your primary responsibility will be executing high quality Risk projects and services from beginning to end under the supervision of experienced Risk leadership. You will be responsible for efficiently managing your workload to budget and learning how to apply technical skills across our various Risk solutions. As a Risk Intern you’ll have opportunities to build client relationships by developing a deep understanding of our clients’ businesses and delivering value through your insight and quality work. In addition, as a Risk intern you’ll focus on continuously developing your technical and professional skills to grow and expand your role in the Risk practice.
Performing detailed analysis to identify and assess compliance or opportunities for improvement, documenting conclusions, and providing recommendations
Utilizing and continuously learning new technologies to collaborate with team members and enhance service delivery
Utilizing various data collection techniques, selecting appropriate method and prioritization to fit project objectives and deliverables, and applying established analytical models to evaluate data, costs and benefits
What are we looking for in an Intern?

Interested candidates should be self-starters and should demonstrate strength in or a desire to build skills related to Grant Thornton’s core values of: Collaboration, Leadership, Excellence, Agility, Respect and Responsibility.

Risk Advisory Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Information Technology, MIS or related field. A Master’s degree is a plus.
Desire to pursue CPA, PMP, CISA, CISSP, CIA, CAMS, or CISM license/certification preferred
Major and overall GPA of 3.2/4.0
Ability to work additional hours as needed and travel 60%-100% as required

Skill Requirements
Interest to work cross functionally throughout different business processes within an organization
Excellent analytical, communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills
Strong technical aptitude and problem-solving skills
Effective project and time management skills for handling multiple priorities and simultaneous projects
Enthusiasm to learn through a combination of structured, on-the-job and self-directed training
Ability to work efficiently and effectively in a complex team environment
Desire to pursue applicable professional certification as outlined above
Exceptional client service and communication skills with a demonstrated ability to develop and maintain outstanding client relationships
Ability to manage multiple engagements and competing priorities in a rapidly growing, fast-paced, interactive, results-based team environment
Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills. Additionally, excellent analytical, organizational, and project management skills
As part of our Risk team you would help our clients assess their internal controls environment via Internal Audit, SOX Readiness / Compliance, Attestation and IT Certification projects. Risk Interns are exposed to various projects across Risk solutions, allowing the interns to discover the advisory services most suited to their skills and interests. Interns can expect to work closely with other staff, managers, and partners on all phases of the engagement lifecycle including planning, engagement management, and project wrap up. In addition, interns are expected to actively contribute to Risk business growth by identifying business development opportunities, participating in marketing and brand initiatives and assisting with development of Grant Thornton thought leadership.

Training

Grant Thornton LLP provides both local and national training programs related to an individual’s job responsibilities. We are committed to ongoing professional development and we encourage individuals to attend outside training seminars.

Benefits

Grant Thornton LLP offers an outstanding opportunity for career growth and development, an attractive compensation and incentive program, generous benefits including immediate participation in our 401(k) plan, and a flexible work environment that offers individual enrichment opportunities in a team environment.

It is Grant Thornton’s policy to promote equal employment opportunities. All personnel decisions, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits and termination, are made without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Primary Location

US-CA-San Francisco

Work Locations

San Francisco(841)

title: PMC Consulting Services Intern
requirements:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Job Description Summary

Envestnet is a leading independent provider of technology-enabled, web-based investment solutions and services to financial advisors. Our mission is to help investors achieve their financial goals, by providing financial advisors the access, tools, and support they need to deliver excellence in wealth management.

The Envestnet Summer Internship is a full-time internship program designed for qualified college students to gain hands-on experience within the Envestnet Chicago Office. In the case that it is not safe to work in-office at the scheduled time of the program, the internships will continue forward as a partially or fully remote program. Interns will work alongside various department experts and collaborate with fellow Envestnet interns on a project presented to leaders in the company.

The Summer Internship program will run from June 2, 2021 through August 6, 2021.

Job Description

Essential Duties/Responsibilities
PMC is seeking an intern to join its Consulting Services Group to assist with work flows that are critical for the successful delivery of high net worth (HNW) solutions and services to advisors and their clients. The Consulting Services Specialist Intern will have responsibilities to assist with investment model database maintenance, advisor database maintenance, portfolio management update communications, enterprise configurations, trade risk reduction assurance, pricing risk reduction assurance, sales metric reporting and sales campaign advisor target list generation.
Knowledge, Skill and Ability
Must be an intermediate user of Excel including VLOOKUPs and Pivot tables
Highly organized with a strong attention to detail.
Effective and concise communicator, both verbal and written.
Possess ability to prioritize and maintain multiple responsibilities.

Education/Experience
Enrolled in an accredited College/University
Degree in business, finance, or related field of study

Compensation, Benefits, & Perks

Envestnet offers the following exceptional benefits: competitive compensation, 401k, and unlimited snacks. We treat our employees well and offer tremendous growth opportunities. Challenging work pushes our people to be creative in a casual environment that is caring, fun, and collaborative. We believe that, when you have smart, happy people working together, you can produce something special.

Envestnet is an equal opportunity employer.

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

title: Evidera Internship Program – Summer 2021
requirements:
Job Title:Evidera Internship Program – Summer 2021

Location: Bethesda, US and London, UK(Multiple Positions Available)

Start Date: June 2021

Level: MSc, MBA or PhD

WORK THAT MATTERS

Evidera is a global research and consulting group that partners with life science companies. Our services are driven by world-class science and thought leadership and leverage a unique combination of capabilities in clinical development, regulatory consulting, HTA, health economics, outcomes research, market access and real-world evidence.

Position Summary

This is an exciting opportunity to join a successful research team for summer 2021! As an intern you will have the opportunity to learn about the role your team of interest plays in helping define and drive solutions for clients and patients.

This entry level, 10-12week position provides support for multiple projects (including ‘live’ projects) under supervision, with the opportunity to participate in targeted self-improvement projects. As an intern, you’ll have mentorship and guidance as well as exposure to a variety of tasks and projects to help you prepare for your future career.

Join Evidera in our relentless pursuit of excellence - apply now!

TEAMS

Value and Access Consulting

The complex and rapidly changing payer environment is becoming increasingly difficult to navigate. Our expert Value and Access Consulting practice, comprising industry leaders, former payers, policy experts, and experienced strategists, help clients steer a path through diverse evidence requirements and potential payer barriers to achieve optimal price and access. Dedicated Value and Access Consulting teams in London and Waltham, MA, have been providing global payer research and pricing, Health Technology Assessment (HTA), reimbursement and market access strategy advice to clients in the biopharmaceutical industry for two decades. Our work is underpinned by relationships with high level payers and advisers covering 45 markets, and integration with world-class experts across clinical development, regulatory, HTA, market access, HEOR and RWE practices.

Peri- and Post Approval Studies (PPAS)

The Peri- and Post Approval Studies team supports biopharmaceutical companies throughout the product lifecycle, from early pre-launch planning to launch and post-marketing management. Our focus is on helping our clients in the pharmaceutical/ biotechnology/ medical device industries build economic and epidemiological evidence to demonstrate and support the value of their products.

Data Analytics - PPAS

), We May Provide Key Information Such As

Through analysis of individual patient databases (e.g., medical claims, electronic health records, registries, etc.
Treatment patterns and drug utilization
Resource utilization
The incidence and prevalence of diseases and co-morbidities
The incidence of adverse events
The impact of various risk factors
Cost-effectiveness
Burden of disease
Comparative effectiveness data
Data Collection - PPAS

Data Collected In These Studies Is Then Used To Address Key Research Questions Such As

The Data Collection team focuses on the design and implementation of de novo data collection studies (retrospective, prospective, and/or cross-sectional).
Burden of disease and identification of unmet needs
Treatment patterns, drug utilization, adherence
Resource utilization
The identification and impact of risk factors on disease outcomes
Comparative effectiveness
Safe;ty outcomes
Modeling and Simulation

Our multidisciplinary Modeling and Simulation experts design and implement health economic models that describe complex medical processes to understand and evaluate the implications of clinical trials; demonstrate the value of interventions beyond efficacy, and assess benefits, risks, and the economic consequences associated with healthcare interventions. If you have a passion for health economic modeling to conduct cost-effectiveness analyses of healthcare interventions and have experience conceptualizing and implementing simulation models (e.g., discrete event simulation) and other decision-analytic models (e.g., decision trees, Markov, individual state-transition, survival partition), a position in Modeling and Simulation at Evidera is waiting for you!

Market Access Communications

Evidera’s Market Access Communications team interprets and communicates the clinical and economic evidence that our pharmaceutical/life sciences clients require to successfully market their products. Our services include dossiers and slide decks that provide healthcare decision-makers with the evidence they need to evaluate new medical treatments, targeted literature-based white papers on diseases and treatments, and reports from payer advisory boards.

Evidence Synthesis

In This Role, You Will Gain Exposure On How To

This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys reading publications and conducting literature reviews. The Evidence Synthesis team utilizes published literature to answer research questions in order to assess complex information for client studies.
Understand new indications in context of specific product strategy
Inform planning for primary research, such as choice of patient-reported outcome instruments and comparators
Estimate clinical comparisons of products versus competitors
Capitalize on existing research while assessing evidence gaps
Provide information for value development planning
Determine which databases have proved useful in target indications
Derive model inputs
Create burden-of-illness assessments for submission to payers
Publish burden assessments for dissemination
Populate dossiers
Populate regulatory documents such as Risk Management Plans
Patient-Centered Research

The Patient-Centered Research group focuses on the development of clinical outcomes assessments (COAs) and patient-reported outcomes (PROs). Our researchers represent a combination of scientific disciplines, including psychometrics, economics, decision analysis, epidemiology, biostatistics, psychology and public health. We develop and evaluate clinical outcome assessments to support labeling and promotional claims. This is a great opportunity to learn more about data collection, including conducting one-on-one cognitive interviews and co-moderating focus groups, literature reviews, site recruitment, and IRB submissions.

Patient Preference

This exciting and challenging cross-functional position provides statistical and econometric analysis as well as data management support across multiple projects within the Patient Preference group of the Patient-Centered Research team. The role requires a unique blend of technical excellence in addition to the ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks with competing deadlines. The Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst is integral to the success of the organization and works closely with a variety of stakeholders; technical and research, to drive the delivery and quality of required programming and results tables. The position offers opportunities for professional skills development and growth.

Medical Writing

Our Medical Writing and Healthcare Communications team has over 17 years of experience delivering consistently high-quality materials for both internal and external audiences. This position supports the mission of Library Services which is to obtain, maintain, and search for information that will assist Evidera staff in the delivery of quality products to their clients. Our writers prepare documents that are clear, concise, scientifically accurate, and fully compliant with regulations, industry best practices, and your corporate guidance.

Finance

The Finance department works closely with Evidera’s business units and support services to help them understand the financial state of the business. They depend on Finance for recording operating activities, tracking changes in business conditions and helping to predict operating indicators. The success of Finance depends on its team of dedicated, strategic-minded individuals. Work alongside some of the industry’s most influential thought leaders to support Evidera’s business growth.

How To Apply

If you are interested, please send:(a)your CV; (b)a cover letter indicating why thisinternshipis of interest to you and; (c)dedicate your interest by selecting the team you wish to apply for in the survey in the next steps.

Evidera, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, genetics, sexual orientation, gender preference, disability, or status as a qualified individual with a disability or protected veteran.

title: Intern Data Consultant (m/f/d)
requirements:
Who are we?

Artefact is a new generation consulting firm. Our point of view: all of our recommendations are based on the very best in data science and artificial intelligence.

In explosive growth since its creation in 2017, Artefact now has 1,000 employees worldwide in 14 countries. The common mission of the Artefactors: transform our customers' data into business impact! We offer our clients, under the same roof, a team profile with a unique DNA: 300 consultants in all-terrain strategy, 200 Data Scientists and ML Engineers, 100 Software & Data Engineers, 500 marketing and media experts representing all trades: SEO, SEA, display, video, social, strategic, creative planners, DA, etc …

We offer a wide range of data-driven solutions, tailor-made to the specific needs of our customers: training Artificial Intelligence to boost decision-making at each stage of the value chain, creating ultra-personalized and innovative consumer experiences , guide our clients on the path of data-driven and digital transformation to the day-to-day management of their media mix and more!

We offer our clients end-to-end support: from identifying opportunities and fundamentals to be consolidated to make them possible, to the development of data platforms and Minimum Viable Products, to the industrialization of solutions in their infrastructure. clean. Where others stop at delivering PoCs, Artefact is the scaling up consultant. We would rather do than say what to do.

We work most of our time in large Cloud platforms: Artefact is a leading Partner of Microsoft (Azure), Amazon (AWS) and the only general consulting firm in France simultaneously Preferred Partner of Google on their Marketing suites ( GMP) and Cloud / AI (GCP).

We are honored by the trust shown in us by more than 1,000 major clients around the world, including the greatest leaders in their industries: Unilever, Danone, L'Oréal, Nestlé, Carrefour, Orange, Deutsche Telekom, Samsung, Ubisoft, AccorHotels , Emirates, Sodexo, Engie, are all loyal customers. The strength of Artefact is based on a unique mix of assets: a very strong emphasis on the permanent training of our teams allowing us to offer our customers always cutting-edge data technologies, an in-depth mastery of Agile methods allowing us to deliver projects very quickly while keeping, step by step, the client / end user at the center of discussions, and multi-skill teams made up of the best experts in their fields.

To support this growth, our Consulting department is looking for a Data Consultant Intern.

Missions

The consultant contributes to the proper execution of client projects. In a team located either within our walls or at our clients' offices, he is supervised by a senior consultant or a project manager.

The Activities The Consultant Will Work On
Defining client needs by conducting interviews with client teams and technology partners
Performing advanced data analysis and conducting research to solve high-impact, strategic problems facing our clients (in autonomy or with data-science teams for any advanced data-science or machine learning subject)
Helping build, formulate and present strategic data recommendations for clients
Helping developing new business proposals to convert client prospects

as well as an active contribution to the development of Artefact: content production (e.g. publication of research work, white papers, points of view), continuous improvement of our ways of doing things, on projects or for internal processes of the Artifact life, etc.

Because we believe internships should be real learning opportunities, we do not differentiate interns from full time consultants in the daily tasks. You will see what it is like to be a consultant !

Profile

The candidate will be able to demonstrate to us their qualities in the most important dimensions in our eyes: curiosity, analytical rigor, intellectual honesty (try many, kill early), hunger to learn and to drive impact.

A first knowledge of consulting (Strategy, Management, IS), data science and ML or digital marketing (within a start-up, agency, etc.) will obviously be valued but is not an obligation

The Recruitment Process At Artefact

Our interviews take place in three rounds and test the candidates' capacities for structuring, analysis and synthesis through customer case studies. The dimensions tested (non-exhaustive list) are as follows: analytical agility, solid structure, creativity, rigor, quality of listening, clarity of purpose, charisma and knowledge of the data and / or digital marketing ecosystem.

Why join us?

Artefact is the place to be: come build with us the future of strategy consulting and marketing

Training: come and experience the most innovative in data science and Artificial Intelligence applied to business issues. You will learn from the best.

Progress: we are recruiting our Partners of tomorrow. Every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn and we believe sky is the limit, not years of experience.

Culture: join a team formed from the most varied profiles on the market, i.e. the best team you can imagine!

Ambition: join a team of (over) motivated entrepreneurs. No stop until # 1.

The first tip is free: join us!

title: Data Analyst Intern
requirements:
About Us:
Barry-Wehmiller is a diversified global supplier of engineering consulting and manufacturing technology for the packaging, corrugating, sheeting and paper-converting industries. By blending people-centric leadership with disciplined operational strategies and purpose-driven growth, Barry-Wehmiller has become a $3 billion organization with nearly 12,000 team members united by a common belief: to use the power of business to build a better world.

The Data Analyst Intern translates data into meaningful and actionable insights for business partners. Analysis performed will directly impact and influence strategic decision making across our organization. The person selected will use reports from disparate data sources to spot meaningful trends and patterns. Findings may be communicated through dashboards, graphs, charts etc. This position works closely with business teams and reporting partners in support of business decision support and product management.

Assist in building and automating ETL pipelines that support advanced analytics projects
Assist in developing statistical analyses and machine learning models whose results are accessible and valuable to leadership

Prioritize, scope, and manage projects

Develop trusted partnerships with business leaders based on collaboration and knowledge of business
Constantly learning and looking for opportunities to improve existing data practices

Capable of working with Microsoft applications, including Excel and Power Query

Intermediate Python or R skills preferred, however any data-focused programming experience is welcome

Understanding and ability to conduct data extraction from a variety of sources
Interest in improving processes and creating efficiencies
Demonstrates curiosity about what drives business trends and customer behaviors
Must be comfortable with constantly evolving environment and rapidly changing priorities
Must be Business-Centric, Data-Oriented, Analytically Minded and Results Driven
Understanding of standard product metrics such as conversion rates, response rates, ROI, etc.
Attention to detail and accuracy
Solid critical thinking skills to scope and frame problems
Displays excellent judgment to understand and support business needs
Must be able to effectively plan and manage responsibilities
Effective communication skills to manage expectations and challenges
Effective interpersonal and relationship building skills to effectively work with teammates and business partners
Ability to develop datasets to support advanced analytics and reporting

 At Barry-Wehmiller we recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. title: Communications Intern
requirements:
Description/Job Summary

TITLE: BCI Communications Intern

INTERNSHIP LENGTH: April 2021 - July 2021[ER1]

Background

Founded in 1991 by company president Joe Blackstone, Blackstone Consulting, Inc. (BCI) is an international service provider supporting nearly 6,000 managed employees. Their earliest partnerships paired the company with the Department of Defense to provide full food, mess attendant, and janitorial services. And while those partnerships continue to this day, BCI's client base has grown to include Fortune 500 companies, hospitals, schools, universities, and industrial sites.

The foundation of BCI's success starts in their corporate office where the executive team oversees the daily operations of all corporate initiatives and field activities. BCI provides a variety of opportunities for highly motivated and skilled individuals committed to excellence in their work. The company is interested in candidates who can appreciate BCI's values of honesty, respect, integrity, teamwork, and achievement.
